name: FireSky Resort & Spa - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: We had a very nice time at the Firesky and would stay there again. The hotel grounds were well kept and the room was nice & clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband was there for a conference and they were served wonderful food. The hotel is in a good location and they provide a shuttle service for free within 3 miles of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at FireSky earlier this year and absolutely loved it. (I filled out a detailed TripAdvisor comment). We were itching to go back, so we booked a two week stay in August 2009.
reviews.title: We said we'd be back - and we were true to our word!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent vacation - we knew the resort well from our last trip and settled in comfortably for our two week stay. It was incredible - we were frequent users of the pool/bar service and also did not hesitate to use room service when necessary.
reviews.title: Relaxing time, nice grounds, friendly staff

reviews.text: We are both sports nuts, so we went to a Cardinals pre season game and caught a few D-Backs baseball games. We purchased all of our tickets online and didn't have a problem securing good tickets a few hours before game time.
reviews.title: Incredibly Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not golf as much as we are used to this time around, but that had to do with us wanting to relax by the pool and enjoy the glorious weather.
reviews.title: I've been to better....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a frequent patron of Kimpton properties, but this was my first visit to Firesky. This is one of the most gorgeous Kimpton hotels I've visited. The grounds are breathtaking--meticulous landscaping, beautiful facade--and the rooms have been carefully remodeled yet preserve the old character of a previous property (Firesky occupies what used to be a motel/hotel on Scottsdale Rd.) The lobby area is spacious, providing more room for socializing than most Kimpton hotels. All rooms have either a balcony or small patio area. Bathrooms aren't glamorous but have been tastefully redone. Rooms are surprisingly large with comfortable beds, flatscreen LG tv, fully stocked honor bar. Some reviews mentioned noise, which gave me some pause when I considered staying here. We didn't here ANYTHING during our stay. Had two wonderful, quiet nights. We spent one afternoon at the pool--again, just beautiful, lush landscaping. The pool area had a very tropical feel with fruit trees and hummingbirds in abundance. The bartender in the lobby bar was OUTSTANDING. She was working solo and no one had to wait long for service. Early evening wine hour was great, as was the morning coffee/tea service. All of the staff were pleasant and more than willing to accommodate requests. We didn't use it, but Firesky offers complimentary shuttle service to anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel. This is a great perk for those who want to spend the evening in Old Town and don't want to hassle with parking (or risk driving after having some drinks). We enjoyed the two block stroll to the Fashion Mall. I can't wait to return!
reviews.title: I Didn't Want to Leave!
Loved it!
reviews.text: Beautiful resort-outside campfires, swimming pool, dog-friendly. Very relaxing stay.

reviews.title: wonderful gem
reviews.text: Just came back from a wonderful stay at this hotel/resort..
Our room was lovely, their restaurant Taggia (great pizza, scallops burrata) and their spa wonderful, great amenities but
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience!

reviews.text: best of all ther staff made us and our dogs feel so welcome and taken
reviews.title: LOVED this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our anniversary in AZ and after staying at other Kimpton's decided to give the FIresky a shot...what a great place!!! The front desk remembered when I booked that it was our anniversary and a bottle of wine and a cheese tray was waiting for us in our room. Extremely attentive staff, especially the pool staff and the Bellhop's out front. Great drinks at the pool (try the pear flower lemonade) as well. Overall, we will certainly be back to stay again, thanks for everything!!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Outstanding service by a friendly and solicitous staff. Virtually everyone we came into contact with, from the front desk folks to the groundskeepers, made it a point to say hello and greet Lucy, our chihuahua, as though she were an honored guest.
reviews.title: The Pet Friendliest of the Kimptons
Very nice hotel, clean and comfortable but might be a stretch as a "Luxury Resort & Spa"
reviews.text: Stayed here with the family (wife & 2 teen boys) for first trip to AZ over spring break. Had a pool view room. Hotel is nice, upscale and clean. Room was standard nice hotel room. It falls a little short of my expectations for 1) a Kimpton hotel and 2) a 4 star resort. It's a very nice hotel, solid, clean, no issues but also not a overly luxurious or spa like experience. Pool area and grounds are very nice, pool is interesting but the lounge chair shuffle gets a bit crazy as it is actually a small pool that fills up quickly. Fire pits and social areas are nice as is the overall gardens / foliage. Food and sundries (other than room service or in house restaurant) are actually difficult to obtain as only other option on premise is the gift shop. The hours of the gift shop are hit and miss as the staff gets pulled off to fulfill other tasks and close the store until they return. While very conveniently located to old town and the mall (short walk, very easy) to run out to get snacks for the kids in the room was a task that required additional resources and actual planning. I had to catch a ride on the hotel shuttle vehicle (very nice service) to the nearest grocery store 1.5 miles away. Nothing within walking distance that sells convenience store type things. Want to emphasize if you get a good deal on the room this is a solid, very nice hotel. I just think if you come here expecting the traditional "Resort & Spa" type hotel it might not meet your expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and enjoyed a lovely, unseasonably warm couple of days in Scottsdale. The hotel was "fully booked" because of Spring Training and there was no ability to check-in early. Once our room was ready, we were disappointed by the decor and the view (a parking lot). The public spaces at his hotel are great - large vaulted ceilings in the lobby, lovely inner courtyards and pool area. But the standard rooms are dark, relatively low ceiling-ed, and while spacious enough didn't really justify the price. The balcony of the room was shallow and looked over the parking lot.
reviews.title: Nice lobby and pool - uninspired rooms.

reviews.text: Not sure we would stay here again - head to the Valley Ho Hotel instead.
reviews.title: Hip and Fun Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: If you're interested in exploring Scottsdale and all the restaurants and shopping, you can't do any better than right here. Especially for the money! I thought the rate I paid was terrific considering this is "high" season in Scottsdale! Beautiful grounds, very peaceful, lovely water features that drown out any noise from nearby Scottsdale road. There are charming little seating areas all over the property. All staff is incredibly helpful and well-trained. It's not a Four Seasons, but you definitely will appreciate the location, location, location, and all the little special touches that make this a great value. Didn't get a chance to use the spa, but it looks great. Had room service from the restaurant and it was very very good. Absolutely no complaints. A relatively inexpensive (for Scottsdale) gem in the desert.
reviews.title: Great value and location
Very exceptional people
reviews.text: I would like to thank the staff at the FireSky Resort. They are truly decent and kind people!

I would highly recommend this resort - the location, service, grounds, etc. were just fantastic. Katie at the front desk was incredibly helpful, as were others... I will not only be back - but will be recommending this place to friends, family, etc.!
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.text: I hosted a meeting here and it did not go well. First off they were going through a remodel that they avoiding telling me about even though my contract specifically stated no remodel during my meeting. The front entrance was a disaster due to adding fountains. I had a dinner scheduled around the pool and the day before they started tearing up the stairs that lead to the pool. My sales contract promised that it was a quick fix and would be done before my dinner. That did not happen and we had to use torn up stairs to access our dinner. Then the workers working on the pool stairs decided to cut all their wood right next to our meeting so we could hear sawing. There was also tons of banging due to breaking up cement in the lobby.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was not helpful. I explained that the banging had to stop and they promised it would stop. It would for maybe 5 minutes and then start up again.
reviews.title: Kimpton Boutique Hotels - Great service and location

reviews.text: We stayed here in March for a family wedding. From the beginning there was trouble. The banquet people "promised" several things to the bride and groom that weren't in the contract, so they never happened. They messed up the reservations for at least six different rooms that I know of, but there were probably more. No one ever did anything about it, or apologized.
reviews.title: The service here was awful

reviews.text: The hotel is an old "motel" that now has the hallways enclosed by doors at the end. The bathrooms have been updated, but the doors are hard to close. They do have a wine hour in the afternoon for free wine, but who wants to hang out at their hotel while on vacation?
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel- Fabulous Location- Fabulous Service

reviews.text: The wedding itself went fine, but the food was only mediocre and there was really only one helpful waiter. The DJ was very good, and did exactly what the bride and groom asked them to do.
reviews.title: A little garden of Eden!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having stayed several years ago at Kimpton's 70 Park Ave in NYC, I now seek out Kimptons whenever I travel, most recently in Portland, NYC and Scottsdale.
reviews.title: Amazing
Relaxing desert oasis
reviews.text: Scottsdale's FireSky Resort & Spa couldn't have been nicer. Calling last minute seeking warm sunshine, we were lucky to get a reservation. Jeanette was terrific, helping us on the phone as my friend and I figured out our trip to Scottsdale. Upon arrival, Clayton went out of his way to be sure we were comfortable. And that was just the beginning. Our room (complete with a pool side view) was lovely - ample space and very comfortable beds. The lunches we had poolside were perfect. Well flavored chicken caesars with a beer - what could be better -- as were the continental breakfasts and of course Kimpton's signature wine hour. The FireSky Resort & Spa is very --- and I mean very--- well located, a short walk to shopping and great restaurants, or if you'd rather, the complimentary shuttle is available for drop off and pick up. The pool was lovely, the staff couldn't have been better, whether poolside, front desk, bar, shuttle service -- you guessed it, I will continue to seek out Kimpton Hotels when I travel.

Stayed here in December 2009 for 3 nights/4 days. First I would like to mention that Kimpton (the company that owns Fire sky) is making huge strides in preserving the environment and our natural resources. This company is wonderful and should be recognized for their efforts. The hotel is an older property that has been updated. The hotel grounds are beautiful! Although the weather was warm considering the time of year, I wished it were a bit warmer so that I could have lounged by their lovely pool. It looks like a shaded lagoon. Our room was large and cleaned and well stocked with bath products, towels, etc. The bed was uber-comfortable. The staff at this hotel went above and beyond to accommodate us in any way that they could. The NEVER said "No". This hotel offers some wonderful extras like a wine hour, coffee/tea in the morning, etc. These things are FREE--and go a long way with guest loyalty. They are also Pet friendly and it was so nice to be able to pet other guests dogs as we were missing our own back home.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: Yes, the walls are a touch thin and some noise can be heard but it did not bother us in the least. Also, we got a beyond fair rate by calling the hotel directly and booking. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Old hotel with paper thin walls and doors.

reviews.text: We stayed at the FireSky Resort, because they do not charge a pet fee, and since it was for only 1 night (I hated to pay the $75.00 - $100.00 per visit at most other hotels) I thought it would be a great place to stay. FireSky had some great reviews too. Well my 4lb. dog heard everything all night (she growled and barked at the door with every noise she heard) I have stayed at many hotels with her and never had any problems. The room was a pet room and smelled like one too. I think next time it is best to stay in hotels that do charge a cleaning fee, because the rooms are kept very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my 3 night stay at FireSky. It was my first trip to the Phoenix area, and the location was perfect. An easy drive to restaurants, shopping, and area attractions. The room was very nice and comfortable. Great bed! The bathroom fixtures were pretty, but a bit worn. Not a big deal to me. The toiletries were good brands, and I enjoyed using them. Loved the wood closet doors and all of the little stylish touches in the room. I liked spending time at the hotel, even getting room service and eating at Taggia (the hotel restaurant) 2 of the nights, which I rarely do especially in a city with so many great places to eat. I would recommend either, although I thought the restaurant was a bit pricy (which is why I usually avoid hotel restaurants, in general). I ate outside at Taggia and couldn't have asked for a better atmosphere! Fireplaces and fountains...beautiful! I enjoyed walking around the resort, and found a quiet spot next to the little lagoon to relax and read. (Was hoping to do so next to the pool, but there were too many kids having a good time for it to be quiet. Luckily, there was room for all of us to enjoy the resort facilities). Service was great everywhere in the resort. Friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Old, overpriced, and paper thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't have the noise problems that I read other reviewers had. Didn't have a fabulous view (and hadn't paid for one), but it was certainly very nice to have a patio. Just a note, if you're on the second floor, don't believe there are elevators (at least I didn't see one in my building) If that's a problem for you, be sure to request a first floor room. Self parking was very convenient and easy.
reviews.title: Ideal weekend getaway

reviews.text: We stayed at Fire Sky for 8 days. March 25 thru April 2..I could not of asked for a better place to stay. Location to Old town and shopping, staff, rooms, restaurant, pools, free shuttle where fantastic. I never heard no from anyone. The garden/pool area is a big hit and is unique in that it has fire pits, private areas and a sand beach. The hotel was packed yet the staff called me by name. Really!!! who does that? Fire Sky was the hit of our trip, "thank you" for such a nice place to stay. For what you get the price is spot on.
reviews.title: First time and wont be the last

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pros: good location for walking to Scottsdale Stadium and stores & restaurants of Old Scottsdale and Fashion Square; friendly staff; free wine; free continental breakfast; free parking; free wifi -- NO RESORT FEE! The cons: somewhat older property; bed too soft; wifi too slow; pool too cold; not enough pool towels. It'd probably cost $75-$100 less in other cities, but Phoenix in March is expensive everywhere!
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: This hotel has many fantastic qualities, and I suspect if it had not been so crowded when we stayed there that I would not have anything negative to say about this hotel. However, I think with this caliber of hotel (and price), they should be able to better accommodate guests when they are full.
reviews.title: Lots of positives, but overwhelmed by spring break crowds

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed at the Firesky in late March for 4 nights. We were on spring break, hoping for some time by the pool, and also to attend spring training games in the area. The hotel is in a fantastic location with Old Town Scottsdale and many restaurants within walking distance. The rooms, lobby, and the pool area are very lovely. The pool area, which also has firepits to cook s'mores in the evening had us very excited that we had chosen the perfect place.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but pretty pricey

reviews.text: However, the pool became a huge frustration as the hotel did not control people putting towels on the loungers to reserve them. If you came down even as early as 8, there were no longer any lounge chairs available, although there was usually very few people actually there. So the pool was the opposite of relaxing for us, as we had to constantly be on the lookout for any chair that might open up. And then to overhear their staff complain about the situation was extra frustrating, as it could be easily solved by having one staff out there early prohibiting this ( there seemed to be plenty of staff). So our planned "pool time", which was a major reason for coming, turned out to be a significant negative of this place.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing, but fine if you get a good rate

reviews.text: We found this place close to the shopping and dining areas in Scottsdale. It's a little oasis, walking distance to town. The rooms were very clean and modern. The pool area had a very tropical feel that was perfect for relaxation. Stayed here two nights, once on a Friday and then the following Monday, before we flew home. We didn't have a reservation, showed up on a very busy day and they accommodated us with a very nice room. I would definitely go back here and recommend to friends!
reviews.title: Trendy, Clean & Relaxing...

reviews.text: Our family had reservations at another hotel in Phoenix at the end of March and upon checking in...we quickly realized the hotel we had chosen was not for us. Luckily we were able to get out of our reservation and I looked at a "last minute hotel" website and discovered FireSky. I quickly called and was informed that they had one room left which was a huge relief because it was spring break and most hotels were full in Scottsdale. The person I spoke with was so kind and accommodating. He asked my children's age and gender because there would be special things waiting in the room for them. We arrived just in time to catch the tail end of the wine reception which the host every night from 5-6) in the lobby. We quickly each got a glass of wine and enjoyed the little oasis that surrounded us. When we got to our room there was a bucket of beers, snacks, cheetah robes for our kids and a pet goldfish! That night our 11-year-old son went to the front desk to ask to reserve a cabana for our anniversary the following day. The front desk was so kind to him but told him that they don't reserve cabanas at FireSky, that they are on a first come, first served basis. That evening, we enjoyed s'mores at the fire pit. FireSide provided little s'more baggies with everything one would need to make the treat. That was a great little perk! We enjoyed a wonderful day by the pool just relaxing and my husband and I also visited the fitness room which was small but had everything we would have wanted as far as fitness equipment. After housekeeping had cleaned the room, we discovered a little basket of chocolate eggs on our bed (it was right around Easter time). It seemed like every time we turned around, we were being given something! That afternoon around 4:00, there was a knock on our door and someone appeared with a bottle of champagne, beautiful chocolate covered strawberries and a hand written note from the front desk apologizing that they couldn't accommodate our son's request for a cabana but wishing us a happy anniversary on his behalf. The note was riddled with compliments about our son and how thoughtful it was of him to think of us! It was then that my husband and I decided that we will ALWAYS look for a Kimpton resort when we travel. We feel so lucky that we stumbled upon this little oasis in the desert. My husband and I plan to return for a warm weekend next February to escape our Minnesota winter. We have traveled extensively both in the United States and abroad and my husband and I both agreed that FireSky was by far THE BEST resort we have ever experienced. The staff truly does care about their visitors and like I said earlier...I will always look to book at a Kimpton resort wherever our travels take us!! Thank you, FireSky for an amazing few days! I forget to mention that the location is awesome and that there is a driver on staff just waiting to take you to many restaurants/shopping (within a three mile radius) with just a phone call. I truly can not say one bad thing about this resort!
reviews.title: I can't say enough about this hotel!

reviews.text: From March 26 through March 31, 2013, we stayed at the FireSky in Scottsdale, AZ. Overall, we had a great stay and found the resort to be a good value. The hotel was beautiful, food outstanding and the grounds very well kept. The staff was uniformly excellent.
reviews.title: Great experience, good value

reviews.text: One exceptionally outstanding exception was a valet named Gary. Gary was working the shuttle service and I unknowingly gave him a $100 bill as part of a tip. Without any hesitation, Gary noticed my mistake and politely called it to my attention. But for his action, I probably wouldn't have noticed what I had done until much later. I greatly appreciate his integrity and good character.
reviews.title: Unexpected Oasis

reviews.text: I took my mom here for a 7 day getaway. She's a hard working teacher and deserved a little R&R. =)
reviews.title: Lovely oasis, great for business & pleasure

aka: Firesky Resort And Spa - a Kimpton Hotel
description: FireSky Resort & Spa is truly an oasis in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale. This luxury boutique hotel is remarkable for its Jurlique Spa, unbeatable location, exceptional service, sumptuous amenities, and the adjacent Taggia restaurant, Aqua Pool Bar and Taggia Lounge. The area boasts more than 250 golf courses, the Scottsdale Fashion Square, Waterfront district, Phoenix Art Museum, Taliesen West – the Frank Lloyd Wright School of Architecture and nearby Sedona and Salt River Canyon.
